description: Initialize Project with Svelte 5, Tailwind CSS 4.0, and Code Quality Tools
steps: Initialize a new SvelteKit project using Svelte 5 as the core framework.
Install and configure Tailwind CSS 4.0 for utility-first styling.
Install ESLint and Prettier to enforce code style and catch errors early (Industry Best Practice).
Configure Husky and lint-staged to run linters before every commit (Industry Best Practice).
Verify the development server starts and Tailwind styles are applying correctly.

description: Implement Local-First Database Layer with RxDB
steps: Install RxDB to serve as the local-first NoSQL database sitting on top of IndexedDB.
Define a document schema that includes fields for DocumentID, Segments (array), and CurrentSegmentIndex.
Create a helper service to initialize the database connection only on the client side (browser) to support offline mode.
Write a test function to insert a dummy document and query it back to verify persistence.
Install PDF.js (Mozilla) to handle PDF extraction directly in the browser.
Create a file upload component that accepts PDF files.
Implement a function that reads the uploaded file and extracts raw text using the PDF.js library.
Ensure the parsing happens entirely on the client side without sending files to a server.
Log the extracted text to the console to verify successful parsing.
Create a utility function using `Intl.Segmenter` to split raw text.
Implement logic to group text into 'Shorts' based on paragraph breaks or a ~1,000 character limit.
Connect the PDF Parsing service (from previous task) to this segmenter.
Store the resulting array of text segments into the RxDB instance created in the backend task.
Install Swiper.js or Embla Carousel to handle the vertical scrolling interaction.
Create a main 'Feed' component that fetches the segmented text from RxDB.
Map over the segments to render a vertical slide for each text block.
Configure the carousel for vertical orientation so it mimics a social media feed.
Verify that snapping works correctly (one segment per screen).

description: Implement Background Video Layer with WebGPU Support
steps: Add a `<video>` tag to the background of the slide component.
Import a set of 5-10 lightweight, looping background videos into the public assets folder.
Implement logic to assign a random video loop to the player upon initialization.
Ensure the video tag uses the `loop` attribute and muted property for auto-play compliance.
Verify video decoding is functioning (modern browsers will utilize WebGPU/Hardware Acceleration automatically).

description: Integrate Native Web Speech API for TTS
steps: Create an audio controller service using `window.speechSynthesis` (Web Speech API).
Implement a function to speak the text of the currently visible slide.
Add an event listener for the `onboundary` event to track which word is currently being spoken.
Ensure the TTS engine stops/pauses when the user navigates away from the current slide.
Update the text display component to wrap words in individual `<span>` tags.
Connect the `onboundary` event from the Audio task to a Svelte state variable.
Apply a CSS highlight class (e.g., specific color or background) to the word matching the current speech cursor.
Test that the visual highlight moves in sync with the audio playback.
Install Hammer.js to manage touch gestures.
Bind a 'Single Tap' event to toggle the TTS audio and video playback (Pause/Play).
Bind a 'Double Tap' event to cycle through the available background video styles.
Verify gestures work on a mobile viewport simulation.
